meanings.sent1: Abolitionism was a powerful force in the fight against slavery.
meanings.sent2: Many people joined the abolitionism movement to help free slaves.
meanings.sent3: The abolitionism rally was filled with passionate speeches and songs.
meanings.sent4: In history, abolitionism stood as a beacon of hope for the oppressed.
meanings.sent5: The impact of abolitionism on society cannot be overstated.

meanings.definition: The belief in the immediate emancipation of all slaves.
meanings.sent1: Her strong abolitionism led her to advocate for the freedom of all slaves.
meanings.sent2: Abolitionism was a radical idea at the time, calling for the immediate release of slaves.
meanings.sent3: At the dinner table, their heated discussion on abolitionism sparked debates.
meanings.sent4: The concept of abolitionism challenged the status quo and sparked change.
meanings.sent5: The fervor of abolitionism inspired many to take action against slavery.
